data.event: Settled in 1641, it is celebrated as the site of the first shots of the American Revolutionary War, in the Battle of Lexington on April 19, 1775.

event.title: is celebrated as the site of the first shots of the American Revolutionary War, in the Battle of Lexington on April 19, 1775

data.event: Settled in 1641, it is celebrated as the site of the first shots of the American Revolutionary War, in the Battle of Lexington on April 19, 1775.
What is now Lexington was then incorporated as a parish, called Cambridge Farms, in 1691.

event.title: was incorporated as a separate town in 1713

data.event: Lexington was incorporated as a separate town in 1713.
Some, on the other hand, believe that it was named after Lexington (which was pronounced and is today spelled Laxton) in Nottinghamshire, England.
